translated: In the section on root cause there are twenty-three. In the section on object there are fourteen. original: nava …pe… novigate pannarasa.

translated: In the section on non-root cause there are eighteen. In the section on non-object there are fifteen. original: (Sahajātavārampi paccayavārampi nissayavārampi saṁsaṭṭhavārampi sampayuttavārampi vitthāretabbaṁ.)

translated: (The section on conascence, the section on relation, the section on support, the section on presence, and the section on presence with which related should be elaborated in detail in the same way as the section on root cause.)

translated: A non-resultant-by-recepti on and a non-resultant-by-recepti on and a non-resultant-by-recepti on and a non-resultant-by-recepti on are conditionally related as object condition. …

original: tevīsa, aññamaññe terasa, nissaye chabbīsa, upanissaye aṭṭhārasa, purejāte cha, pacchājāte🔽nava, āsevane cha, kamme cuddasa, vipāke pañca, āhāre terasa, indriye aṭṭhārasa,🔽jhāne magge terasa, sampayutte nava …pe… vippayutte dvādasa …pe… avigate chabbīsa.
analyzed: tevīsa aññamaññe terasa nissaye chabbīsa upanissaye aṭṭhārasa purejāte cha pacchājāte  nava āsevane cha kamme cuddasa vipāke pañca āhāre terasa indriye aṭṭhārasa  jhāne magge terasa sampayutte nava pe vippayutte dvādasa pe avigate chabbīsa
translated: In the case of cause, there are thirteen. In the case of object, there are eighteen. In the case of predominance, there are seventeen. In the case of proximity, there are sixteen. … In the case of contiguity, there are sixteen. … In the case of immediacy, there are sixteen. … In the case of repetition, there are twenty-three. … In the case of kamma, there are fourteen. … In the case of nutriment, there are thirteen. … In the case of faculty, there are eighteen. …

original: (Pañhāvāraṁ vitthāretabbaṁ.)
analyzed: pañhāvāram
translated: In the case of jhāna, there are thirteen. … In the case of path, there are thirteen. … In the case of association, there are nine. … In the case of dissociation, there are twelve. … In the case of absence, there are twelve. … In the case of presence, there are twelve. … In the case of disappearance, there are twelve. … In the case of non-disappearance, there are twelve. … In the case of the past, there are twelve. … In the case of the future, there are twelve. … In the case of the present, there are twelve. … In the case of the unarisen, there are twelve. … In the case of the arisen, there are twelve. … In the case of the decayed, there are twelve. … In the case of the undeclared, there are twelve. … In the case of the past and future, there are twelve. … In the case of the past, future, and present, there are twelve. … In the case of the unarisen and arisen, there are twelve. … In the case of the unarisen and decayed, there are
